newsitem.title: SRI LANKA: Sri Lanka to buy 100,000 tonnes of wheat.
newsitem.headline: Sri Lanka to buy 100,000 tonnes of wheat.

text.p: Sri Lanka's state buying arm the Co-operative Wholesale Establishment has opened a tender for 100,000 tonnes of soft and hard wheat, government officials said on Thursday.
The tender, closing on January 3, is for 50,000 tonnes of soft wheat for delivery in the third week of January and 50,000 tonnes of hard wheat for delivery in the second week of February, they said.
On November 27, Sri Lanka bought 100,000 tonnes of wheat from Australia and Argentina.
